title: Matchmaking for low levels is DISGUSTING. Is this being addressed at all?
body: I just waited in a 5 minute queue to play against a Diamond ranked midlaner. My summoner level? 15. I'm still learning things, yet I get put up against a high leveled player. I can't speak for everyone, but IMO being constantly stomped while still trying to learn isn't fun.

The problem is that the game is snowbally,you make some mistakes early(not too sure what those are),then he has gold and exp lead,then you make some small mistake and die,then his lead is bigger,you make a minor mistake and die.

You learn the most if your opponent is even or slightly better,if he is a lot better you don't even know what you are doing wrong.

I still remember the time i played against someone VASTLY better than our entire team. I was new enough i still hadnt seen this champion called "jax" played, was around level 10 or so, and he died not even once during our entire game. No one on our team could touch him. 5v1 and we lost hardcore. It wasnt fun, it wasnt a learning experience, what i took away from that was that it was an op broken champion. Looking back, i realize its because the guy playing him was that damn skilled with the champion. You really do learn from them being only slightly better than you. Too far ahead and its like watching humans as an ant. You cannot comprehend whats going on at all.

Watching a commentary on youtube where thy explain everything theyre doing, thats huge. In game, better to face someone just superior enouhg to force you to adapt or youll be too busy getting destroyed to pinpoint your mistakes
If you could record the video of the game, it could help. Look at it later on and go like ha that was dumb or, why did I do that? Why didn't I buy a pink ward?

I don't understand why it's so hard to match people within 3 levels of each other. Riot really seems to have adopted a "Level 30 problems or gtfo"
because the player pool within 3 levels for low level players is quite small per region.

Hard? No, its not hard. 

the question is, are you willing to wait in queue for 30 minutes? Im pretty sure Riot can implement a system where you get matched perfectly according to your rank/level, but the wait times to do so would be extremely long.

The only solution would be to make matchmaking wait longer to look for similar level/experienced players. Getting stomped may not be fun, but how long are you willing to wait for each PvP match with ~level 15's? 10 minutes? 20? 30? At some point, people will quit LoL over it before they can reach level 30.

Honestly it isn't all that great on the other side of things. Even though I only peaked at gold 4 or 5 (back in season 4 or so, then grad school happened and I accumulated a LOT of rust) it is frustrating to end up with someone pre30 on your team because you know they don't have a full rune page, let alone an optimal one. My suggestion for Riot would be to make it so pre30 and people at level 30 are actually in separate queues so they couldn't get matched together. It isn't so much that level 30s are more skilled (many would be due to greater experience/game knowledge) but more that pre30s aren't on a level playing field in terms of runes so they are at a disadvantage automatically and can be a detriment to their team mates as a result.

As a Diamond player I usually don't get matched against lower people unless I queue up with friends.  When I solo it's pretty even.

Look at how the queue works(dont quote me on this)
1st priority: find an equally experienced player
2nd: find one slightly above or below
3rd: find anything

**It's generally based on your mmr**. (match maker rating) Normal and ranked mmrs are separate, so you can occasionally be matched up with someone much more experienced than you if they play only ranked, because their normal mmr is still left behind at where they were long before they became diamond.
